page.title: 17NORTON POST OFFICE.
page.content: Norton Post Office has existed in one form or another for nearly a century and is situated in a quiet country lane. It started life as a bakery, but has now been converted into a post office and grocer. The present owners, Mr & Mrs A.T.Mabbett have been in residence since September 1980. As well as running the Post Office they supply Norton with things such as tinned foods, soft drinks, fruit, bread confectionary, and various other household items as well. On a normal day, one of the Mabbetts will run the shop, but on Thursday, their 'busiest' day of the week, three people have to lend a hand in running the shop. It is busier than usual because all of the older inhabitants of Norton go to collect their pensions.
